meanings.definition: to convert or change into an isomer
meanings.sent1: Chemists can isomerise compounds to study their different structures.
meanings.sent2: During the experiment, the molecule will isomerise into its mirror image.
meanings.sent3: The potion accidentally caused the frog to isomerise into a tiny toad!
meanings.sent4: Her perspective on life seemed to isomerise after the enlightening trip.
meanings.sent5: The wizard's spell had the power to isomerise reality itself.

meanings.sent1: The chemical solution will isomerise when exposed to heat.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the substance will naturally isomerise into a more stable form.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar seemed to isomerise into a butterfly overnight!
meanings.sent4: As the seasons change, the landscape begins to isomerise into a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The music seemed to isomerise, transforming from a slow melody to an upbeat rhythm.
